intro: Lucuma macahensis, commonly known as the Andean sweet potato, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, orange-colored tubers. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves and is typically grown in cool, temperate climates. Its tubers are rich in carbohydrates and have a sweet, nutty flavor. Due to its unique taste and nutritional value, it is gaining popularity in both traditional and modern culinary applications.
